content.webTitle: Jonny Donahoe: ‘I have very boring dreams – I once dreamed I was making toast’

fields.headline: Jonny Donahoe: ‘I have very boring dreams – I once dreamed I was making toast’
fields.bodyText: The funniest standup I’ve ever seen … Jonny Donahoe: I must have watched Dylan Moran’s DVD of Monster, recorded at Vicar Street in Dublin, about a hundred times. It’s storytelling, almost character standup but the gag rate is higher than most one-liner comedians. Oh, if you haven’t seen it just watch it, it’s bliss. Paddy Gervers: Every time I see Bridget Christie she simultaneously changes my life and makes me laugh so hard I have to leave and lie down. She is utterly, utterly wonderful. The funniest sketch I’ve ever seen … JD: Cake Factory from Big Train. It’s a very simple and tight idea and lovely writing but the thing that makes it are the performances from Simon Pegg and Rebecca Front. PG: My go-to “oh I have to show you this incredible sketch” sketch is Key & Peele’s Continental Breakfast, closely followed by The Day That Robert Palins Murdered Me from I Think You Should Leave which is the sketch I most wish I’d come up with in my life. The funniest dream I’ve ever had … JD: I have very boring dreams. I once dreamed I was making toast for ages. I woke up and was both bored and annoyed that I still had to make the toast. The funniest person I know … JD: My friend Mike Bartlett – who I went to school with and who has since written some of the best dramas on TV and in the theatre – makes me laugh probably more than anyone else. The funniest hairstyle I’ve ever had … JD: I don’t understand how a hairstyle is funny. Does that mean something you regret? Or are embarrassed by? I don’t care how I look very much so all my haircuts are both wonderful and hilarious. PG: I used to cut my own hair at school because it had to be off the collar, so for years my hair was perfectly collar shaped all the way round. I looked like a backwards mullet enthusiast. The funniest joke I’ve ever heard … JD: Colin Hoult’s alter ego Andy Parker had the quip: “Never apologise, never explain. [Beat] Sorry, I got that from a book.” Jonny and the Baptists play Barnsley, Saturday 9; Newcastle upon Tyne, Tuesday 12 November; touring to 18 December
